verses.text: 行事完全為 神喜悅詭詐的天平是耶和華所厭惡的，準確的法碼是他所喜悅的。
傲慢來，羞辱也來；謙卑的人卻有智慧。
正直人的純正必引導他們自己，奸詐人的奸惡卻毀滅自己。
在 神發怒的日子，財物毫無益處；唯有公義能救人脫離死亡。

words.definition: not in the least, utterly without

words.note: A key biblical term, but also used secularly.

words.definition: get rid of, break away from

verses.text: 完全人的公義，必使自己的路平坦正直，但惡人必因自己的邪惡跌倒。

words.note: A key biblical term, but also used secularly.

verses.text: 正直人的公義必拯救自己，但奸詐人必陷溺於自己的惡慾中。

words.note: Lit. 'upright person'
Lit. 'treacherous person'
Classical preposition
Used as a postposition

verses.text: 惡人一死，他的希望就幻滅；有能力的人的盼望也消滅了。

words.note: Lit. 'evil person'

verses.text: 義人得蒙拯救脫離患難，惡人卻來代替他。

words.note: Lit. 'righteous person'
Lit. 'evil person'

verses.text: 不敬虔的人用口敗壞鄰舍，義人卻因知識免受其害。

words.note: Lit. 'righteous person'
Classical possessive/demonstrative pronoun

verses.text: 義人亨通，全城歡樂；惡人滅亡，大家歡呼。

words.note: Lit. 'righteous person'
Lit. 'evil person'

verses.text: 因正直人的祝福，城的地位就提高；因惡人的口，城就傾覆。

words.note: Can be a verb 'to bless' or a noun 'blessing'.

verses.text: 藐視鄰舍的，真是無知；聰明人卻緘默不言。

words.note: Often used in formal or biblical contexts, similar to '鄰居'.

verses.text: 到處搬弄是非的，洩露祕密，心裡誠實的，遮隱事情。
沒有智謀，國家敗落；謀士眾多，就能得勝。
為外人作保證人的，必受虧損；厭惡替人擊掌擔保的，卻得著安穩。

words.note: In ancient times, clapping hands sealed a pact.

verses.text: 賢德的婦女得著尊榮，強暴的男子只得著財富。

words.note: Often used in biblical contexts to describe noble character.
Combination of 'get' and an aspect particle indicating successful attainment.
Combination of 'get' and an aspect particle indicating successful attainment.

verses.text: 仁慈的人自己獲益，殘忍的人自己受害。

words.note: A key Confucian virtue, 'ren', combined with 'ci' (compassion).

verses.text: 惡人賺得的工價是虛假的，播種公義的得著實在的賞賜。

words.note: A common term in religious texts for those who do evil.
Literally 'labor's price', referring to payment for work or a reward.
Combination of 'get' and an aspect particle indicating successful attainment.
Implies a gift from a superior or divine entity.

verses.text: 恆心行義的必得生命；追隨邪惡的必致死亡。
欺詐的心是耶和華厭惡的；行為完全是他所喜悅的。

words.note: Hebrew name of God, transliterated into Chinese.
Used before verbs to form a passive or nominalized structure.

verses.text: 惡人必不免受罰，但義人的後裔必蒙解救。

words.note: Lit. 'evil person'
Lit. 'righteous person'
Often indicates passive voice or favor received.

verses.text: 婦女美麗而無見識，就像金環帶在豬鼻上一樣。
義人的願望，盡是美好，惡人的希望，必招致忿怒。

words.note: Lit. 'righteous person'
Lit. 'evil person'

verses.text: 有人慷慨好施，財富卻更增添；有人吝嗇過度，反招致貧窮。
樂善好施的人，必得豐裕；施惠於人的，自己也必蒙施惠。

words.note: An idiom describing someone who enjoys doing good and giving.
Classical Chinese preposition, often replaced by '對' or '在' in modern Mandarin.
Often indicates passive voice or favor received.

verses.text: 屯積五穀的，必被人民咒詛；出售糧食的，福祉必臨到他的頭上。

words.note: Refers to spiritual and material well-being.
Here implies 'upon him' as a recipient of the blessing.

verses.text: 殷切求善的，必得到愛顧；追求邪惡的，邪惡必臨到他。

breakdown.m: to care for; to look after

verses.text: 倚賴自己財富的，必然衰落；義人卻必繁茂，好像綠葉。

words.definition: to rely on, to depend on

verses.text: 禍害自己家庭的，必承受清風；愚妄人必作心思智慧的人的僕人。

words.definition: to bring disaster to, to harm
to bear, to endure, to receive

words.note: Lit. 'clear wind', but contextually means inheriting nothing or empty possession.

verses.text: 義人所結的果子就是生命樹；智慧人必能得人。

words.note: Often used to form a noun phrase from a verb, meaning 'that which is V-ed'.

words.definition: to win souls, to win people
words.note: Refers to gaining influence or bringing people to wisdom/righteousness.

verses.text: 義人在世上尚且受報應，何況惡人和罪人呢？

words.note: Refers to a person who is just and righteous in character or action.
Used to introduce an even more surprising or extreme case.
Often implies negative consequences for actions.
Used to introduce a rhetorical question, suggesting the subsequent case is even more certain.
Used at the end of a rhetorical question or to soften an inquiry.
